events.title: Execution of Mary, Queen of Scots
events.description: Mary, Queen of Scots was executed at Fotheringhay Castle for her involvement in plots to assassinate Queen Elizabeth I of England.
events.significance: This event marked the end of Maryâ€™s claim to the English throne and intensified the conflict between England and Catholic Europe.

events.title: Russo-Japanese War Begins
events.description: Japan launched a surprise naval attack on the Russian fleet at Port Arthur, starting the Russo-Japanese War.
events.significance: This war shifted the balance of power in East Asia, marking the first time an Asian power defeated a European one in modern history.

events.title: First International Women's Day Celebrated
events.description: The first International Women's Day was observed on February 8 in some countries to promote women's rights and suffrage.
events.significance: It helped catalyze the global movement for women's rights and gender equality.

events.title: Apollo 14 Returns to Earth
events.description: NASA's Apollo 14 mission, the third manned mission to the Moon, safely returned to Earth after successful lunar exploration.
events.significance: This mission contributed valuable scientific data and advancements in human spaceflight.

events.title: Ryutaro Hashimoto, Former Prime Minister of Japan, Dies
events.description: Ryutaro Hashimoto, influential Japanese politician and two-time Prime Minister known for economic reforms, passed away.
events.significance: His death marked the loss of a significant figure in Japan's post-war economic and political development.
